alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 10:38PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Humboldt County through 1115 PM PDT... At 1038 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 14 miles southwest of McDermitt, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Humboldt County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding, especially on US Highway 95 south of McDermitt. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
